name: The Carter Center
mission: It seeks to prevent and resolve conflicts, enhance freedom and democracy, and improve health.
theoryOfChange: The Carter Center has a published 'Peace Programs Strategic Plan' (April 18, 2022). This strategic plan outlines the Center's response to global challenges and commits to 'implementing high-quality, evidence-based programs'. It details an expanded focus within conflict resolution, democracy, human rights, and the rule of law, incorporating 'new programming tools and program approaches'. These include enhanced collaboration with local stakeholders, extensive integration across program areas for a systemic approach, an analytical approach with cross-cutting themes like gender, climate change, and health, a country assessment process, and articulated criteria for engagement and disengagement. The plan also sets 'aspirational goals to achieve by 2027' and mentions an 'accompanying implementation plan will operationalize the key elements of the strategic plan and set specific targets for measuring success'. The document is described as a 'living document that projects a clear direction but provides sufficient flexibility to ensure that The Carter Center can respond to unforeseen global developments and ongoing assessments of program effectiveness'. Additionally, The Carter Center's Human Rights Program has three strategic objectives that guide its work: advancing the rights of protected groups, promoting climate and environmental justice, and providing responsive expertise to pressing human rights issues.
zakatClaimEvidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://secure.cartercenter.org/site/Donation2?df_id=1220)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 26/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: The Carter Center Inc shows moderate alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Organization is in zakat denylist (partners but doesn't collect directly) (Source: https://secure.cartercenter.org/site/Donation2?df_id=1220)

all_citations.claim: The organization reports a program expense ratio of 81.4% and holds 91.0 months of working capital.
The organization provides various donation options for general charitable giving (sadaqah).
The Carter Center Inc reported total revenue of $153,773,756 and operates programs for conflict resolution and democracy.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates robust financial health and efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by a focus on long-term capacity building and advocacy rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Limited direct evidence of cost-per-beneficiary metrics for specific health interventions
Heavy reliance on advocacy-based models which can be difficult to quantify in terms of immediate impact

dimension_explanations.alignment: As a sadaqah-eligible organization, it offers various ways for donors to contribute to humanitarian causes [2]. The alignment score is medium, reflecting its status as a high-profile advocacy group with a long track record, though its specific fit for Muslim donor requirements is centered on general charitable giving rather than specialized religious pathways [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The Center reported a total revenue of $153,773,756, directing 81.4% of its expenses toward programs like conflict resolution and democracy [1][3]. While it maintains a strong financial foundation with 91.0 months of working capital, the impact score reflects a focus on capacity building where direct cost-per-beneficiary data is not always available [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Carter Center Inc works globally to prevent conflict, bolster democratic institutions, and eradicate preventable diseases.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.4% ensures the majority of funds reach core initiatives
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with only $0.08 spent to raise every $1
Extensive working capital of 91.0 months providing long-term operational stability
baseline_narrative.summary: Founded on the principle of advancing human rights, The Carter Center Inc operates diverse initiatives including its Conflict Resolution and Democracy Programs [1][3]. The organization seeks to improve global health and enhance freedom through direct field interventions and international advocacy [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates robust financial health and efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by a focus on long-term capacity building and advocacy rather than direct service delivery.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization holds <cite id="12">91.0 months</cite> of operating expenses in reserve, which is significantly higher than necessary for operational stability.
The organization currently meets <cite id="13">0/20 standards met</cite> according to the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization meets 0 of the 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's massive scale and endowment-like structure may necessitate larger reserves than typical charities.
risk_factors: Holds <cite id="19">91.0 months</cite> of working capital, suggesting funds are not being immediately deployed.
Meets <cite id="20">0/20 standards met</cite> with the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns for donors involve excessive capital accumulation and a lack of compliance with standard charity accountability frameworks.

confidence.notes: Financial data is robust, but impact metrics are lacking.

alignment.explanation: The alignment score of 26/50 reflects a medium fit for Muslim donors, as the organization focuses primarily on an <cite id="18">advocacy cause area</cite> rather than direct emergency relief.
alignment.improvement: Add a dedicated page or clearly state whether donations are eligible for specific faith-based giving categories.

credibility.explanation: Credibility is supported by a large board of <cite id="14">43 members</cite> and detailed financial disclosures, though it is hindered by meeting <cite id="15">0/20 standards met</cite> with the BBB.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should address the gaps identified in the BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards.

impact.explanation: The impact score of 23/50 is driven by a strong program expense ratio of <cite id="16">81.4%</cite> and a clear theory of change, but is heavily penalized by excessive working capital of <cite id="17">91.0 months</cite> and missing cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact.improvement: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Provides substantial funding to foreign entities and domestic democracy-focused organizations.

rich_narrative.headline: The Carter Center Inc works globally to prevent conflict, bolster democratic institutions, and eradicate preventable diseases.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support long-term global health initiatives and democratic institution building through general charitable giving.
donor_motivations: Value long-term capacity building over immediate emergency relief
Prioritize organizations with massive scale and financial stability
giving_considerations: Donations support an organization with very high existing reserves
Impact is often systemic and difficult to measure on a per-dollar basis
Not suitable for donors seeking to fulfill specific faith-based obligations
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate, direct humanitarian aid or those requiring strict adherence to BBB accountability standards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has a clear theory of change but lacks verified, publicly available cost-per-beneficiary metrics and long-term outcome tracking in the provided data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization seeks to prevent and resolve conflicts, enhance freedom and democracy, and improve health through capacity building and advocacy.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Clear evidence and outcome tracking ensure that donor funds are effectively translating into measurable improvements in global health and democratic stability.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With 91.0 months of working capital, the organization has massive reserves and low immediate need for operational funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its dual focus on democratic institution building and disease eradication.
peer_comparison.peer_group: Large International Advocacy and Health Organizations

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses exclusively on human rights advocacy without the disease eradication component.
similar_organizations.name: Amnesty International

similar_organizations.differentiator: Investigative focus on human rights abuses globally.
similar_organizations.name: Human Rights Watch

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="7">81.4%</cite> of its total expenses toward program services.
The charity is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending just <cite id="8">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite>.
Financial data indicates a 3-year revenue CAGR of <cite id="9">11.9%</cite>, demonstrating sustainable funding streams.

strengths_deep_dive: The Carter Center demonstrates strong financial fundamentals, particularly in its operational efficiency. By maintaining a program expense ratio of <cite id="10">81.4%</cite>, the organization ensures the vast majority of donor contributions directly support its mission. Furthermore, its fundraising efficiency of <cite id="11">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite> is exceptional, maximizing the impact of development efforts.
rich_narrative.summary: The Carter Center Inc, founded in <cite id="1">1982</cite>, operates globally to advance human rights and alleviate human suffering. The organization reported total revenue of <cite id="2">$153,773,756</cite> in its most recent fiscal year. It maintains a strong focus on its core mission, directing <cite id="3">81.4%</cite> of its expenses to programs. The organization demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="4">$0.08 per $1 raised</cite>. With a 3-year revenue CAGR of <cite id="5">11.9%</cite>, the organization shows steady financial growth, though it currently holds excessive working capital reserves of <cite id="6">91.0 months</cite>.
